article_title: Don’t Blame the Fed for Low Rates
article_text:
The frequent claim that Federal Reserve Chair Janet Yellen and her colleagues are responsible for continuing low rates of interest may be correct in the small, but not in the large. The Fed does set the federal-funds rate—the overnight interest banks charge to lend to each other—and surely affects the timing of rate changes, but not the longer-run level. The real villain behind low interest rates is President Obama.

Long-term rates reflect weak job creation and credit demand. As the Fed correctly points out in its...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, William Poole says don’t blame the Federal Reserve for low interest rates—long-term rates reflect weak job creation and credit demand, both a result of President Obama’s poor economic stewardship.
twitter.title: Don’t Blame the Fed for Low Rates
